In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` in Julia that takes a string and wraps it at a maximum width of 10 characters by default. If you want to specify a different width, you can pass it as an argument.

```julia
function wrap_string(s::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    lines = Vector{String}()
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word * " "
        else
            current_line *= word * " "
        end
    end

    # Add the last line
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
s = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped at 10 characters."
wrapped_string = wrap_string(s)
println(wrapped_string)
```
